snippet: How most of us think about mortality rates is wrong. That’s good news if you are an infant, not so much if you run the Social Security Trust Fund.
abstract: The Upshot; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says life expectancy at birth in United States in 2013 was 76.4 years for men and 81.2 years for women; American child born in 2013 will probably live six or more years longer than current averages; death rates fall over time as health and safety improve.
lead_paragraph: How most of us think about mortality rates is wrong. That’s good news if you are an infant, not so much if you run the Social Security Trust Fund.

headline.print_headline: Why Your Children Will Live Longer Than You Expect
headline.main: Your Kids Will Live Longer Than You Thought

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
